metadata.title: CVE-2016-7069 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: An issue has been found in dnsdist before 1.2.0 in the way EDNS0 OPTrecords are handled when parsing responses from a backend. When dnsdist isconfigured to add EDNS Client Subnet to a query, the response may containan EDNS0 OPT record that has to be removed before forwarding the responseto the initial client. On a 32-bit system, the pointer arithmetic used whenparsing the received response to remove that record might trigger anundefined behavior leading to a crash.

criterions.comment: dnsdist: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
